Responsibilities: Improved the functionality of an interactive accessibility map
Optimized zoom-in and sidebar navigation features
Designed and implemented a robust backend system using Python
Built secure and scalable RESTful APIs with Flask/FastAPI
Focused on user privacy and data security by integrating encryption protocols and adaptive learning
Enhanced the LightGBM algorithm with custom loss functions and feature engineering
Developed robust preprocessing methods to clean and manage a sample dataset of 60,000 rows
Designed and fine-tuned an ensemble forecasting system combining SARIMA, LightGBM, and Transformers
Researching and planning backend architecture for a Dynamic Course Recommender app
Investigating machine learning libraries such as sci-kit-learn and TensorFlow to develop personalized course recommendation algorithms
Evaluating web scraping tools like BeautifulSoup and natural language processing libraries for gathering and analyzing course information
Planned and designed an intuitive interface using vanilla JavaScript
Implemented features and interactions to elevate the overall user experience
Led a team of 200 in a startup initiative involving 1000 people during the second wave of COVID-19 in India
Coordinated efforts with contractors to secure oxygen cylinders and essential supplies

Projects.Name: DocuQuery
Contributions: Developed a lightweight document-based QA tool
Processed and chunked PDFs into over 1,000 context windows using SentenceTransformers
Delivered real-time answers through a local Streamlit UI

Projects.Name: Resumagic
Contributions: Built a client-side AI tool leveraging Gemini API and PDF.js to convert resumes into responsive portfolio websites
Integrated AWS Lambda for secure Gemini API interactions and implemented usage throttling
Deployed the frontend via Amazon S3 and CloudFront

Projects.Name: Findr by OpuLnt
Contributions: Collaborated with a team of four to develop a lost-and-found app for ASU students
Designed secure systems for interactive item listings and direct messaging

Projects.Name: EventFinder
Contributions: Developed an iOS app that allows users to search for events
Integrated with Ticketmaster Discovery API to fetch event data
Implemented expandable event cards, Apple Maps integration, and employed SwiftUI, CoreData, and MVVM architecture

Projects.Name: ThriveSpace
Contributions: Developed a full-stack web app focused on mental well-being
Designed secure systems to ensure robust data privacy

Projects.Name: Hacks for Humanity
Contributions: Led the implementation of a website feature featuring an OTP password generator login system
Orchestrated the complete back-end development for the full-stack project
Played a key role in constructing specific sections of the database and applied the 6-Sigma (DMAIC) concept

questions.question: During your internship at PwC, you worked with a large dataset. Imagine you discovered a significant error in the data after completing a substantial portion of the analysis. How would you proceed?
options: Immediately inform the team and supervisor, outlining the error and potential impact. Discuss possible solutions and implement the agreed-upon approach, documenting the changes thoroughly.
Discreetly attempt to correct the error without alerting anyone, prioritizing project completion. If successful, briefly mention the correction during the final presentation.
Halt all further analysis and dedicate time to investigate the root cause of the error.  Once identified, present a comprehensive report to the team and supervisor before proceeding.
Focus on completing the analysis with the existing data. Acknowledge the error in the final report and suggest future investigations into its cause and impact.

questions.question: While leading the ParmarthNGO initiative, you faced the challenge of coordinating efforts with contractors during a crisis.  If a crucial supplier failed to deliver oxygen cylinders on time, how would you have handled the situation?
options: Immediately contact alternative suppliers and explore all available options to procure the cylinders as quickly as possible, keeping stakeholders informed of the progress.
Escalate the issue to higher authorities and request their intervention to expedite the delivery from the original supplier.
Ration the remaining oxygen supply and prioritize patients based on their needs while simultaneously working to secure new cylinders.
Calmly explain the situation to those affected, emphasizing the external factors contributing to the delay, and provide regular updates on the estimated delivery time.

questions.question: Reflecting on your work on Resumagic, you chose to use AWS Lambda for secure API interactions. Imagine a different team member strongly advocated for using a different serverless platform.  How would you approach this disagreement?
options: Organize a meeting to discuss the pros and cons of both platforms, considering factors like cost, security, scalability, and team familiarity.  Reach a consensus based on the evaluation.
Defer to the team member's suggestion if they can provide compelling reasons and demonstrate the advantages of their preferred platform.

Explain the rationale behind your initial choice, highlighting the specific benefits of AWS Lambda in the context of the project, and remain open to alternative solutions if presented with sufficient evidence.
Stand firm on your decision, emphasizing your experience with AWS Lambda and confidence in its ability to meet the project's requirements, while acknowledging the team member's input.
